page.title: 03Farming in Rathmell N.W.
page.content: Because of the uneven nature of the ground and the often inclement weather, animal rearing is the major farming activity. Cows and sheep may be seen,the latter especially on the higher and rougher pasture to the west,where they roam freely for much of the year. Mechanization is directed to improving the grassland and harvesting the crop. At harvest time tractors and trailers to and fro between field and farm throughout the hours of daylight (or beyond!) taking advantage of a dry spell in the weather.There has been a move away from haymaking to cutting the grass for silage. Once cut, the grass is collected green and stored, often under black plastic sheeting. It rots down and is used as winter feed. It gives a rather different scent to the country air!
